posts.cooked: My auto code, created in pathplanner doesnt work at all. The gyro on smartdashboard reads -412, and my starting position for the auto path is 180 degrees. for some reason, when my robot is facing forwards and is reset, the gyro always reads as -172, and does not seem to operate within a range of 0 to 360. I think this causes my main issue, which is that when I run just a basic “move forward” auto path the robot drives in big circles.

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked:
Most gyros operate with continuous values, meaning that once they reach 360°, they continue on, so 1° would be read as 361°

If you could share your code, maybe a video of the auton, that would help in fixing it.

Edit: also check for gyro offsets

Contribute to Mateo-Johnson/RobustSturdy3 development by creating an account on GitHub.

theres robot code for you, it should be mostly in drivesubsystem

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked:
First thing I notice is that you are creating a rotation2d class when you initialize your drive subsystem, that won’t ever be updated unless you change it’s value.

Put it in period instead, it’ll be updated every 20ms there

Continuing to look through…
The robot has apparently stopped moving in circles now, but here’s the video robotvid.zip (2.9 MB)

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked: any chance you can post a yt link instead of a zip? (or similar)

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked: Awesome, thanks Which path are you running?

I am running the path named New New Path: image 985×825 50.6 KB

image 985×825 50.6 KB

image 985×825 50.6 KB

we put it in the middle just to demonstrate behaviour, but it does virtually the same things from the starting position

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked: The path is doing the right thing, but your “front” of your robot might not be where you think it is, try power cycling then running paths to find out which side is the front
how would i change which side it thinks is the front?

https://imgur.com/a/AnrU6ZI

after power cycle and everything. also pushed some new code to github

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked: gyro offset or different gyro mounting
do you think thats the root of my issue? what about the gyro seemingly not resetting?

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked:
Not knowing the front of your bot is a big issue;

your gyro not updating is probably due to smartdashboard not updating or the actual value not being updated in your code

posts.name: Max Morehead
posts.cooked:
You’re not resetting your gyro anywhere in your code, as far as I can tell ( zeroHeading is never called). However, that shouldn’t matter because it’s accounted for by the odometry class. If you want to get the angle of your robot you should just print out the rotation member of the pose. Not sure what’s causing the issue though.

Does field oriented driving in teleop work correctly?

On a separate note, I want to make sure you know about the I2C lockup issues:

This article details known issues (and workarounds) for FRC ® Control System Software. Open Issues: AdvantageScope isn’t updated by WPILib Installer on macOS: Issue: When running the WPILib Install...

link_counts.title: Known Issues — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: i do know about the I2C lockup issues, on our final we just use the I2C port on our navX. Our field oriented drive in teleop works perfectly currently
